review.reviewBody:
I'm always pleased with my Patagonia purchases. These pants didn't disappoint. They have a flattering fit (I'm 5'3", 120 lb, and I ordered a size 4/short). They hit at the base of my ankle. They're light weight, but you can always wear leggings underneath for the winter. They aren't rain pants.
You cellphone will fit in the side pocket which zips with a bit of effort.
review.name: You can always trust Patagonia

review.reviewBody:
It's an impressive choice for long-distance trail running shoe. Right from the start, I appreciated the excellent midsole volume with solid cushioning. Initially, the shoes felt a bit stiff, but after logging around 80 miles, theyve started to break in nicely and now fit my preferences. However, I wasnt a fan of the cheap, thin innersole; I ended up replacing it for a more comfortable experience. Love the aggressive tread, good for running on the damp PNW trails.

Overall, Im quite pleased with the Spin Planet shoes and would recommend them to anyone looking for a comfortable, eco-friendly option for long distance trail running.
review.name: Great trail runners

review.reviewBody:
Used them in the 100k Grindstone Ultra 2024 , worked flawlessly for me.  Thats a more technical east coast trail with rocks , roots and steep ascent / descents.  

I think these have excellent stability and ground feel despite the cushioning, and I can navigate difficult terrain with confidence.  Fast on descents.   Lots of energy return too.

I compared them to a few other similar shoes such as Saucony Xodus Ultra , Brooks Catamount, ASICS Trabuco, Hoka Mafate, Hoka Tecton x3 and I liked the Scarpa the best - surprisingly.

I will say I see a lot of trail runners now going for the super trail shoes like Tecton X3 , and I think on your more technical terrain something like the spin planet is just better unless you are elite or something.  They provide good support and more secure descending.
review.name: 100k Ultra Ready

review.reviewBody: I generally wear a 12 as one foot measures 10.6in and the other measures 11.6in.  I bought the 46 and they fit perfectly.  I deal with plantar fasciitis and have insoles in these shoes but the shoe is plenty stiff and supportive without them.  Ive had them a month or so now and wore them to Europe and back and they did great.  I would buy them again!
review.name: Love Em!

name: Spin Planet Running Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the Fox Racing Ranger Wind Vest - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Ranger Wind Vest - Men's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Fox Racing Ranger Wind Vest - Men's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: For me this is nearly the perfect vest for most rides here in East TN and Western NC from late October thru spring. Wish the back was mesh or perforated for more breathability, but other than that its great! Cuts wind well, sheds light rain, holds warmth surprisingly well, packs in its own pocket. Large is a bit roomy on me at 62 175 lbs but that gives me flexibility to wear it over a warmer layer comfortably. Size down from your normal t shirt size if you want it to be more fitted. I might have preferred a medium but didnt feel like messing with the return. This is not a roadie fit garment and would even look good over a flannel having a beer back at the trailhead watering hole.
review.name: Almost perfect!

name: Ranger Wind Vest - Men's

review.reviewBody:
Just got this shirt and I wish I paid more attention to the one review that mentioned the tag. The tag of the shirt is on the left side of the shirt and it scratches and I can't emphasize this enough. It scratches so bad I had to take it off after an hour. You can't just cut it off, it's the way it's stitched in that's the reason for scratching. So I'll need to see if I can unstitch this, remove the tag, and then stitch it back together. If it works I have a shirt that's ok in other aspects. Nothing spectacular. If it doesn't work that's money wasted. I would expect much better from Fjallraven. 
PS: really wanted to add images but the add images section is nonresponsive.
review.name: The tag inside is terrible

review.reviewBody: Bought this shirt in medium at the Boulder, CO store and its easily my new favorite shirt. Great fit, slick design, and high-quality fabric.
review.name: Excellent shirt

review.reviewBody: Just a heads up this shirt has a fitted design. So you may want to order a size up if you dont like fitted garments.
review.name: Love this shirt!

review.reviewBody: I really like this shirt and it fits very well. It's soft and looks great. However, the tag of the shirt is on the left side of the shirt and it scratches. It is very annoying and I have to wear an undershirt with this or else it irritates my skin. I don't think this is supposed to happen so maybe I need to exchange it, but it is very uncomfortable.
review.name: Great shirt, scratchy tag!

review.reviewBody: I love the colors and the logo proportions of this t-shirt is my second one. Fits well
review.name: Grate and simple

review.reviewBody: Absolutely love the quality of this T shirt! Perfect in quality ways. But only criticism is that an XL runs a little bit tight, did not see an XXL offered. Im American, just wondering if this is a European to American clothing size issue. Anyway Im happy!
review.name: Love it totally, a little tight

review.reviewBody: I am 6 ft and 195lbs and the XL fit perfect. Great quality material with the 60/40 split. Highly recommend.
review.name: Excellent Shirt

review.reviewBody: The T-Shirt fit me great. I like the ochre color that combine better on any bottoms. I bought 2 of different colors (other is caper green). The European size as I'm 165cm and 60Kg so XS is perfect for me. Maybe I'll order that chalk white one
review.name: Fit me as slim guy

review.reviewBody: I've treated mine like any other quality shirt I own and it still has pilled because of cotton shrinking even though it has only ever been hung to dry.  It is very uncomfortable as a result and the first disappointment of several other fjallraven items I own.
review.name: cotton shrunk and pilled

review.reviewBody: Quality material and well-made; however the size runs small.  If you like skin-tight shirts you may be OK with the "European" sizing.  Order the next size bigger than what you normally would wear.
review.name: High Quality, But Size Runs Very Small

name: Logo T-Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: The 5.1 is a huge improvement over Lenz's original socks. Heat distribution in the toebox is fantastic and the app is easy to use. Also, the improved cuff holds the battery more firmly. It is a tad thicker than the super thin socks your boot fitter recommends (hey, they need to be able to conceal wires). And speaking of batteries, I disagree with the reviewers who claim to be victimized by not realizing this is a "bare tool" without batteries. It's clearly stated in the description and anyone who has researched these the socky + battery sets should know better than to not look twice if the price seems too nice.
review.name: For those who like to feel their toes

review.reviewBody: Socks do work great but you need to purchase the battery packs to use them which are pretty expensive as well.
review.name: BATTERY SOLD SEPARATELY

review.reviewBody: SO while you look at the reviews and the tech description- there is nothing that indicated the battery pack is Separate and will cost you another couple of hundred bucks.  A bit of smoke and mirrors I think.
review.name: be aware- this is not a complete package

review.reviewBody:
Wore battery assisted boot heaters while skiing and even then my toes were cold. I suffer from poor circulation, and with heat adjustment using my phone, I am able to regulate heat temp while riding on the chairlift. Hard on the wallet, but when its cold and windy the sticker shock is forgiven.
The size runs just a little big, I wear a size 9W shoe and suggest trying a medium sock on before purchase. Either way, youll be happy.
review.name: Game Changer

name: 5.1 Heat Sock

review.itemreviewed: Carbon LS-100 II Cycling Shoe - Men's
review.reviewBody: I feel the same about the adjustability (or lack thereof) as Kyle Koch The shoes are so stiff that if your foot is the wrong shape, you don't have a lot of options. My feet fall asleep after 30 minutes of riding. My only option is to loosen the single boa, but then my heel is bouncing in and out. Great shoes for the right foot. Very light and stiff. But tough on my wide and high arched feet.
review.name: Great shoes for the right feet
comment: You probably need to look at Sidi then, as I had Sidi's first, and found that the LG Carbon LS-100 II actually fit my foot better, the Sidis seemed to be better for a wider foot and/or higher arched foot; I guess I got lucky as this shoe fits my feet almost perfectly, I have two pair, one white for hot weather and one black.

name: Carbon LS-100 II Cycling Shoe - Men's

Buy the Favero Assioma DUO pedal online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Assioma DUO pedal
hasVariant.description: Buy the Favero Assioma DUO pedal online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
These are the gold standard power meter. Ive used these for more than 10k miles without a single issue.
The guy that left a negative review probably uses a Shimano power meter since its a more trusted brand.
review.name: Best power meter on the market

review.reviewBody:
I no longer use these but used theme a lot over the past 2.5 years. At first, they were great. I used them to train with on a peloton using trainer road - they paired well and worked well. I also used them for road rides over that time period. 

As time has progressed, one pedal has completely stopped pairing - it appears on but doesnt pair with the assigns app or any 3rd party apps. Further, the one transmitting pedal constantly drops out during training sessions. Sometimes when this happens it will not pair again with TR or the assigns app. The only fix Ive found is to let the pedals die, then fully charge them. Still, this leaves me with only one transmitting pedal and it works only a few sessions before no longer pairing with anything. 

I guess Im done with these after 2.5 years. Id love to contact assioma CS but I need the serial numbers from each pedal to do so. The serial numbers are available via the app once the pedals are paired. But the pedals arent pairing so 

And yes, pedals are updated with the latest firmware. 

I now have a better training set up and power meters on all bikes so these pedals are on the shelf. I do not recommend. I recommend finding the extra money and buying a more reliable brand.
review.name: I do not recommend

name: Assioma DUO pedal

review.reviewBody: The spring tension on the gate just seems unnecessarily high as it is on the nano. This is it's only fault. Still really easy to operate one handed due to the nice design. The colors are vibrant and the finish is primo. Way better than BD biners. Docking one star because I still paid double the price for a Helium instead. Those are just a joy to handle and this one is just a tiny bit of a pain because of the gate spring.
review.name: Gate a bit too stiff

review.reviewBody: Great quality and I especially love the green color.
review.name: My fav wiregate

review.reviewBody:
This carabiner is literally the lightest and cheapest option. I'm racking all my cams on them at this point and building alpine draws with them as well. The size is big enough to operate with a glove on as well which is sick. The top of the carabiner is also so much narrower than my others that when my cams are on photons I can rack more on a gear loop.
Theyre dope.
review.name: Lightest and cheapest

name: Photon Wire Carabiner

review.reviewBody: After swapping stems on my trainer/rain bike and discovering tons of caked-on sweat around the steerer tube (yum!), I bought this.  It does the job.  Like other reviews, I found that my thighs rub the material a little while riding.  I seem to have worked around it by lengthening the strap that goes around the seat post to move the whole thing forward an inch or two.
review.name: Does what it says

description: Buy the Stoic Portable Camp Kitchen Island online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Portable Camp Kitchen Island
hasVariant.description: Buy the Stoic Portable Camp Kitchen Island online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I got this on mega sale for $43. It showed up and bent before I even got it out of the package. Im not an ape, its just cheese grade metal. I tried to return it and apparently backcountry has this new policy where certain items are not returnable. Absolute waste of $43. I wouldnt pay $10 for it.
review.name: Absolute trash

review.reviewBody: The bars across the back are a little chinsy. Bent the bracket holding a gallon of water in a solar shower right away. Going to add some real steel reinforcements. Slightly bulky but at least it all fits in the bag. Wish there was a cover for the sink as I don't wash dishes at campsites and would rather have the extra space. But for holding my campstove at a comfortable level and solar shower for washing hands once I add some gussets, it's pretty good.
review.name: Decent but needs mods

review.reviewBody: I bought this in June 2022, and have used it on camping trips about 10 times since then. Very easy set up and break down. Sturdy, no wasted space.  The only reason it doesn't get a 5 is that the sink drain clogs easily, so I rarely use the line.  It's great as a dishwashing rinse sink, and washing in other tubs.
review.name: Excellent choice for car camping

review.reviewBody:
The longest pole is very difficult to pack. The item is bulky and the sink doesn't exactly hold water. 
Also the cross pole doesn't even fit the holes properly, so all my stuff just falls off.
I want to return it but they said I need original packaging..which I of course recycled immediately..thinking it would actually put together properly.
review.name: Doesn't fit!

review.reviewBody: ive used mine about 4 times, it makes cooking great giving me plenty of space to work with however it takes up nearly my entire cars back seat or trunk, its very heavy and does not pack down well. the poles are fairly sturdy but the sinks drain is basically useless it got clogged up within 2 uses so just switch it to a regular cap.
review.name: decent for cooking but way to bulky

review.reviewBody:
We purchased this product for extended camping trips. It barely made it through one trip. The tall pole broke almost immediately. By the middle of the trip, the countertops were showing serious signs of water damage around the sink. If you're hosting a large camping trip and really need this sort of thing, maybe it's worth your $100 to use once and throw away. It's not worth mine. 

Happy camping!
review.name: Great idea, poorly executed

review.reviewBody:
I was honestly skeptical of this table just due to the fact there were no reviews. Well i pulled the trigger on it. One trip out to the Delaware river for annual boys weekend and it did well! 

Pretty easy to set up/break down, shouldnt take more than a minute or two and I was surprised with how sturdy it was. Seems like it'll hold up pretty nicely. 

My biggest complaint and I'm being knit picky, the side tables aren't long enough to check all the boxes. I can fit my Coleman two burner propane grill on top and would have liked if the side tables were longer for cutting boards etc. It could work if you stand and face the sides and all is good. I know I'm asking for a lot for a camping set up and i realize that. 

All in all after one long weekend, I'd recommend. I plan on bringing it to another camping trip and a few times on the beach. Will update.
review.name: Have used once, have initial impression

name: Portable Camp Kitchen Island

hasVariant.name: Diva Gel Superflow Saddle - Women's
hasVariant.description: Buy the Selle Italia Diva Gel Superflow Saddle - Women's online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: Finally, after hundreds of dollars and many saddles, this is the one. It is the right width, cut out, and softness. Cycling has changed from night to day. I no longer feel like Im sitting on a brick in ultimate pain. This is the right saddle. Best wishes to my amigas.
review.name: This is the one

review.reviewBody: I rode my last Selle Italia Diva for 10 years, its old and the leather is showing wear, It's still comfortable and well broke in but when I got my new bike I thought it deserved the new saddle, so I got another Diva hoping it would be as comfortable as my old one. It did not disappoint me, from the first ride, it feels just like my old trusted friend, supportive and comfy, I don't think there is a better saddle for me. I know not everyone will have the same experience as I have with the Diva, we are all built different and what works for me may not work for others but I would encourage anyone in search of a good saddle to try the Diva. They also come in two sizes, small and large. I love my Diva!
review.name: My Favorite Saddle

review.reviewBody: This seat was too firm for me. It felt like the right size and contoured me physically, but the surface is very hard and seems to have no padding at all. By the end of an easy 14 mile ride I was dying! My stock seat was better than this one. Returning and will try something different.
review.name: Like a brick!!!
comment:
Brandi nothing worse than having a great day spoiled by a sore....Believe it or not the fit is probably more important than padding. A completely non padded seat that you can rest your sitz bones on can be an all day seat. This one comes in two sizes and it would be interesting to see if the wider (or narrower) version might have been a good day? As you legs get stronger you tend to float a bit more as well so sometimes ironically just more saddle time will improve your comfort. Clip in pedals cause you to build a push/pull pedal style and this keeps the tension going over most of the rotation. The better you get at this the faster you go and oddly the less weight you are putting on the saddle. 
Anyway hope your doing better and keep riding!!

name: Diva Gel Superflow Saddle - Women's

hasVariant.name: Onesource Eaved 10x10 Shelter
hasVariant.description: Buy the Coleman Onesource Eaved 10x10 Shelter online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: This is great for outside yard or park areas where theres not a lot of wind. I do not advise in ocean beach areas where winds are strong. Great value and easy setup.
review.name: Great item

review.reviewBody: Coleman canopy tent has saved us from the blazing sun on several occasions! It's easy to set up and break back down. Has an extra built in wind vent at the top. Large enough to fit a nice size table underneath. This is a must for camping, beach trip or just backyard grilling if you don't have a patio covering
review.name: Durable

review.reviewBody: We like to use this during games and motocross, it keeps the sun off us during the hottest days, the durability is great and the lighting is awesome too! I would definitely recommend if needing a canopy!
review.name: Shady!!

review.reviewBody: Love this canopy! Works great to provide some shade for our OneSource tent, and the colorful lights make camping feel like a party! Super easy to set up and take down.
review.name: Highly recommend!

review.reviewBody: I've purchased numerous Coleman tents over the years, and have always been pleased. Last year I bought an Iowa Hawkeyes tailgate tent, 10 x 10, and have been so disappointed.  Only one year of normal use, and the fabric already has multiple holes wearing through, a few of which I've had to put duct tape over to keep them from getting bigger. For how expensive these are, I really expected better quality.
review.name: Extremely disappointed
comment:
Hi there!

Thank you for contacting Coleman, the Outdoor Company, and taking the time to provide feedback on our Coleman OneSource 10 x 10 Canopy Shelter with LED Lighting & Rechargeable Battery. We are sorry to hear that the canopy of your shelter has multiple holes. We appreciate your time and effort for bringing this to our attention, and we apologize if our product did not exceed your expectations. This is certainly not the experience we want you to have. We want to make sure that we provide quality products that have great value, stylish and will suit your needs. As we are looking for ways to better our product and service, we always ensure that consumers' feedback and concerns are shared with the concerned department. Please let us know if you need further assistance.

Thank you and have a wonderful day

review.reviewBody: The lights stopped working after about 45 minutes. Battery says its fully charged but the lights wont turn on. Waste of money
review.name: Stopped Working Almost Immediately
comment:
Hi Alex187,

Thank you for contacting Coleman, the Outdoor Company, and providing feedback on your Coleman OneSource 10 x 10 Canopy Shelter with LED Lighting & Rechargeable Battery. We're sorry to hear that your shelter's LED lights ceased operating after roughly 45 minutes, despite the fact that the battery was completely charged. We appreciate your time and effort for bringing this to our attention and we apologize if our product did not exceed your expectations. This is certainly not the experience we want you to have. We want to make sure that we provide quality products that have great value, stylish and will suit your needs. As we are looking for ways to better our product and service, we always ensure that consumers' feedback and concerns are shared with the concerned department. Please let us know if you need further assistance. Have a wonderful day.

review.reviewBody: I bought one of these late last year and put it up.  It lasted 2 months before it was torn to shreads.  I really like the lighting so I left it up, but the shade is gone.  I have bought Coleman in the past and have had a lot of luck but this one did not cut the mustard.   I would like to find a new fabric cover.
review.name: Not durable
comment: Thank you for posting a review, and we appreciate you sharing your experience with our product. We understand that it was not the quality you expected. We hope you will allow us to discuss this further with you. You can reach out to us at 1-800-835-3278, Monday - Friday from 9:00 am - 5:00 pm CST or you can email through our website https://www.coleman.com/contactus/. We hope to find a solution that makes you smile.

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Coleman is my go-to brand for anything camping or outdoors related. This canopy is made sturdy and its very easy to set up. We get a lot of use out of the attached LED lights at night when we're camping. The only thing it's missing is a screening to keep bugs out, but its definitely a great product!
review.name: Perfect!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I took this camping for the first time and it was a blast! It was so fun to change colors from the LED lights and also protected us very well from the rain . A neat feature that I really enjoyed was that I could charge my phone from the port on the pole of the canopy tent. I will be using this at all of my kids sporting events! I can make the colors match their team colors.
review.name: So fun!

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] We use this canopy shelter for an unorthodox use.  As general contractors, we set up the canopy to cover our power tools on the jobsite. Our workers report the canopy is a breeze to raise.  We prefer to cut material outside to keep the dust out of our homeowner's residence.  With a moveable table underneath, our tools are out of the elements in case of an impromptu shower.  Our area also is known for tree pollen.  The canopy protects the tools from the green sticky yuck that falls from the trees.  The LED lights are a bonus for a work site.  The canopy is set up and deconstructed all the time and it is very substantial. Highly recommend.
review.name: Easy to set up

name: Onesource Eaved 10x10 Shelter

review.reviewBody: I 'm very excited about this jacket, it has an easy comfortable fit , plenty of room in the shoulders , has great zippers for storage and keeps me dry in the rain.
review.name: Love this jacket

review.reviewBody: Great coat, comfortable. Havent worn it yet in the elements but I think it will become a favorite. Colors are great, lime green & berry. Love this coat!!
review.name: Very nice

review.reviewBody: Great jacket but very disappointed in misleading photo online of the color. Color online very clearly looks grey and burgundy on cuff and zippers. Actual product is all grey with black zippers, no burgundy anywhere! Too bad, was really excited for the grey and burgundy! Still a nice jacket but disappointed in the color.
review.name: Carbon Color not grey and burgundy!!!

review.reviewBody: I am really enjoying this jacket. I love the color. Tested it out and some wet snow. And its bombproof.
review.name: Great jacket

review.reviewBody: Wore this jacket out for the first time skiing up at Rainier and it was great. It kept all the cold wind out but the pit zips were great to keep me well vented on the way down. The material is so soft and moveable I never felt impeded by the jacket at all. Its also a beautiful color. I am a pretty solid small and the small fit me great! Still has room to put more layers on underneath too. Im 52and about 135lbs the arms are a little long but nothing to really complain about. I do wish that there were inside pockets but its a lightweight no frills great option!
review.name: Great jacket for the slopes

review.reviewBody: I ordered the Women's Recon Shell in Blackberry color. It's more maroon than purplish, as it looks on the website. The jacket is light and the fit is on point. I ordered a small and it fits loose with layers under. One drawback is that there is no internal pocket. It has a "pass pocket" on the sleeve, which for me is a waste of a zipper and adds weight, but it really could use an internal drop pocket for gloves, a field observations book, or other items.
review.name: Lightweight and nice fit but needs an internal pocket

review.reviewBody: I love the color and fit of the jacket. Its light weight but still wind and water resistant. Its my new daily skiing jacket.
review.name: Just the Shell I was looking for.

review.reviewBody: Feels great, looks great, sleeves are long enough! Can't wait to get it out into some snow.
review.name: Gorgeous coat

review.reviewBody: The ideal mix of breathability and protection. This is the shell for me. I hope BD never gets rid of the Recon LT line because they've nailed it with both the shell and snow pants for backcountry skier and boarders. The fit is amazing. I am between size small and medium generally and I go with the smaller size (small) in almost all BD outerwear. It fits wonderfully with room for layers. The length of this shell is great, not too long to adhere movement and not too short to allow snow in. If you are an avid backcountry rider the Recon LT kit is a great investment.
review.name: This is the Shell

review.reviewBody: This shell is lightweight, windproof, and water proof. Perfect for layering as the outer layer. Well built with nice touches like waterproof seams on the zippers. The only downside is the lack of an internal zippered pocket for valuables. Also no internal pocket for a phone/tunes. As an added bonus, could add internal monkey-paw sleeves like the Dawn Patrol shell has to keep snow out. Would buy again. Lots of comments on how nice it looks paired with the pants.
review.name: Good Shell

review.reviewBody: I purchased this Patagonia sweater vest to replace an old Marmot down vest that's seen better years on the hiking/camping trail. I did the research to find a vest whose down has been responsibly harvested, sufficiently rated for down content , lightweight and well made with the two inner pockets, and a zipper which so far has been worry free. The price was reasonable, and the delivery from Back Country was quick. I learned the hard way many years ago that wearing adequate layers of clothing while in the wilds is essential for combating life- threatening hypothermia. This vest is a comfortable component of my mid- layering ensemble. This vest will do it's job as long as I do mine in remaining safe while in my beloved wilderness. As John Muir pit it "Going to the woods is going home. Even the grey-green color is nice.
review.name: A welcome replacement for an old friend

review.reviewBody: This vest looks just as presented in pictures on website. My son said the down makes it so warm for his core, while allowing his arms to be free to move. He is a very hot natured guy, so I thought it might be too warm. So, he wears it with a long sleeve shirt and shorts! Ha! And he absolutely loves it, making me happy as I gave it for Christmas. It looks good on him, too; not too puffy.
review.name: My Man-Son loves this vest!

review.reviewBody: Not a bad vest, the collar is a bit excessive.  Not really a complaint, more an observation, the sedge green isnt as green as it appears in the pictures.  Its more a gray green on arrival.
review.name: Sedge Green isnt very green

review.reviewBody: I have had two pairs of blundstones now, they are awesome boots, that are super cute and functional, but completely kill your feet. Definitely size a whole size up. I have tried half sizing but the shoe only gets wider and I still have huge blisters and painful feet at the end of the day. Going to see if going a whole size up helps but otherwise may have to try another boot out.
review.name: Too small

review.reviewBody: 6 months and many miles laterThe best all-around boots I've ever owned! I've worn them practically every day - no exaggeration. It does take about two weeks to break in, but they're only getting better with age. These boots are a solid investment. Theyre a do-it-all type of shoe. Different styles fit slightly differently, I do have another pair of bloodstones that fit a bit more snug, so I had to size up a half size, but these fit true to size (I bought an 8).
review.name: Literally wear these every day

review.reviewBody: Beautiful boot, runs small. I usually wear a 9, bought a 9.5 and it was super small. I will exchange for a 10.5 b/c I would love to wear some thick socks with them. Hopefully that works.
review.name: Runs Small

review.reviewBody:
Normally, I am a true size 7 in women's shoes. I ordered a size 7 in the rustic black color, and when they arrived, I was surprised that my toes were smashed into the end. I walked around in them for a bit in my home, and eventually concluded that I should order a half size up.

What I didn't know is that the half sizes in Blundstone's lineup are their wide sizes. So the 7.5 is the same length as the 7, but has a wider fit. I ended up ordering an 8, which fits my toes perfectly with the comfort liners inserted into it to make the boot more snug.

I haven't broken them in yet or really worn them asides from the initial try on, so I can't really speak to the break in process or longevity of the boots.
review.name: Funky Sizing!

review.reviewBody: I think I actually bought these from the Backcountry catalog before I shopped online.  I have worn them rain or shine, hot or cold for 20 years, and they are still going strong.  Thinking about contacting Blundstone to have the soles replaced, but the best shoe I've ever worn.
review.name: 20 years and still going

review.reviewBody: I usually wear a U.S. size 7.5 and got the size 5 (UK) in the Rustic Brown boots. I bought these to wear for work and hiking. But I'd say they're better for walking around town and have great traction, but the ankle area is not supportive/sturdy enough for hiking. They definitely needed to be broken in - the back of the boots pressed into my leg right below my calves when I first started wearing them. It hurt so bad for a good week, but I toughed it out and then for a month I wore them every single day and they were perfect. But a couple of weeks ago a deep crease formed only on the right boot, right above my heel (Achilles tendon area). It's so incredibly painful to walk in the right boot now. My Achilles tendon is swollen and bruised from the deep crease pushing into it every step I make. Meanwhile the left boot is completely comfortable with no deep crease in that location. This was after only 1 month of wear. One would think that a $200 pair of boots would be a bit sturdier and better constructed to not bend so much after 1 month of wear.  I've never had this occur before with one boot getting a crease so deep I couldn't walk because of the pain. Blundstone wouldn't replace the one boot as they deemed it normal and I can't return them for a refund because I wore them. Unfortunately Blundstone's product isn't sturdy or worth the hype.
review.name: Let Down

review.reviewBody: I?m pleased with the boot, I have another style of blundstones and know they?re hellacious to break in, but the fit is nice. Not super excited that both the included insoles were covered with pet hair. Kind of gross. Paid a lot of money for the boots, would have liked them to be clean. Not upset that they were a return, they don?t look worn, just?not pumped about the small white hairs covering the inside of the boots.
review.name: Boots are good looking

review.reviewBody: I wear boots year-round and typically stick to Doc Martens. A few years ago I purchased a pair of the higher top Blundstone's in black and was extremely impressed with the quality and durability. I was wanting a pair of brown boots and decided on these which I'm glad I did! They are rustic looking and ready to go right out of the box, no break in needed. I get compliments on these wherever I go and can be dressed up or dressed down with ease. I'm normally a US 8.5 and took these in a US 9.
review.name: Love these boots

review.reviewBody:
I spent MONTHS looking at reviews for these and agonized over whether or not I actually needed these shoes. Once they came, not sure they've ever left my feet (kidding, sort of). These shoes are incredibly comfortable right out of the box and only get more comfortable the longer you wear them. I found the height to be perfect, they come to just above my ankles, and they look great with skinny jeans, mom jeans, and I even find myself wearing them with dresses in the summer. I purchased the Rustic Brown color and love it. 

Sizing is a bit confusing, but they are true to size,  remember half sizes are width. I am usually an 8.5-9.5 in women's shoes, with a pretty wide foot, so i purchased a 9.5 US/6.5 UK in these. They fit perfectly - snug enough to wear with light socks in the summer, but generous enough I can squeeze in with some thick cozy socks in the winter. Hoping these serve me well for years to come!
review.name: I wear these every day

review.reviewBody: Boots are very comfortable and sturdy without being bulky and heavy! I love them but I got my original size and that wasn?t a good idea. I just got a return label and purchased a size up. Remember half sizes are only width not length! But overall very nice boots!!! I got the color stone Nubuck (a little more money) but it?s a gorgeous color!
review.name: Run small (in length)

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Amazing coat that ever little boy or girl should have
review.name: I love  this coat, style, color and its not bulky

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very cozy and warm coat for my 7 year old daughter. I ordered a kids Medium (Grapefruit color). She is pretty tall and athletic build. It's roomy on her and I intentionally sized up a bit so it might last two seasons. It's high-quality material and the color is bright and unique, none of her peers with the same kind so it likely won't get mistaken for someone else's :)  Very happy with the purchase!
review.name: Cozy warm kids down hoody for 7-year old girl

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Excellent puffer. Light weight, yet warm and stylish for our Minnesota winters. Bought a navy and black so they can be different ;-) Nice quality. Large for my 11 year old and Small for my 9 year old. I think the arms are perfectly sized to accommodate all kids.
review.name: Girls Puffer

review.reviewBody: This puffer served our 9-year old very well last season through several trips to colorado and the alps, as well as daily school use. It packs easily and is extremely lightweight. Comes out of the wash looking new, if you follow some basic tips for washing down (great for potential resale or hand-me-down). It's in perfect shape after a full season of use last year, and I'm hoping it will fit him again this year for the rest of the coming winter season. If not, I'm ready to size up if needed because this jacket is perfect. With the elastic wrist bands, you can size up because the elastic keeps the sleeves up if it's a little big - a good feature in case of growth spurts or possible two-season use.
review.name: best kids' puffer

review.reviewBody: My grand daughter wore the coat 2-days she sends me a pic where the coat rip an the stuffing is coming out
review.name: Coat rip
comment:
Hello,

Thank you for your feedback on our Kid's Guides Down Hoody. We really appreciate you bringing this to our attention.

We are very sorry to hear about the issue with the jacket.

For assistance, please submit a warranty claim at https://www.marmot.com/warranty-repair.html or call us at 888-357-3262. We are available Mon. 9AM - 5PM EST. 

Thank you!
Marmot Consumer Care

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Awesome super puffy jacket. Almost unbelievable how much down is in the baffles. Xs works for my 2 1/2 year old and should work for at least 1 or 2 more seasons. S works for my 4 year old and likewise I expect well get another season or 2 out of them. Very happy with the jackets so far!
review.name: Super puffy, cute and functional

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My daughter loves it! Cute color and nice fit. It looks good on me too!
review.name: Nice and soft

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My daughter loves it, super plush, super warm, she wears it even when she doesn't need it. She's my little marshmallow in this coat.  I have the Stockholm edition and this one is very, very similar. My only complaint is that it seems a little small for it to be an extra-large compared to other brands, otherwise we love it. I still highly recommend this coat, you can't beat the quality and sale prices of Marmot.
review.name: Just like Dad's

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Very durable and warm jacket! This is the second one I've purchased for my boys, the first has been unbelievable for my most adventurous, hardwearing son. Fit is great and we've been able to hand them down to the next kid due to the excellent to date durability.
review.name: Great durability for multiple kids!

review.reviewBody: The sleeves are abnormally long. This is not normal measurements. Way longer than that from our brands ( paragon, gap, north face). Worse buy ever
review.name: Sleeves are way too long!
comment:

Thank you for providing us with feedback on the jacket.

We are very sorry to hear that the sleeve length has not met your expectations.

We will make sure to forward your idea and feedback to an appropriate department, so that we may think about changing the measurements for this item in the future collections.

At the same time, we may advise you to return the item free-of-charge by initiating the return process here:

https://www.marmot.com/Support-Show?cfid=returns

 Thank you so much for sharing your opinion with us.

If you have any more questions, please reach out to us via [URL-https://www.marmot.com/support/contact-us] or through LiveChat. Were available Mon.-Fri. 9am-5pm Eastern Time.

description: Buy the Osprey Packs Talon 33L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Talon 33L Backpack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Osprey Packs Talon 33L Backpack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
This is my second pack from Osprey, the other being a 48.
They are great rucksacks with every convenience covered and great for either single or multi day hikes
review.name: Backpack

review.reviewBody: Great bag very light, been up winter hike with it fits all essential kit, ice axe and walkingbpoles fitted well. Really pleased.
review.name: Talon 33l

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] My new pack is perfect! Osprey is awesome! It fits great, is super comfortable and is well designed. I would bever buy a pack from anyone else.
review.name: My new pack is perfect!

review.reviewBody: Super annoying that they've stitched the lid to the main body in the newer iteration. Now when it's full the lid tips forward in to your head. Stupid! Otherwise a very nice bag
review.name: Super annoying that they've stitched

review.reviewBody:
My second Talon 33, replacing the first when repairs to the webbing pockets proved impractical. The current version is similar - the main difference noticed so far is that the lid is fixed rather than floating, and I prefer this change. 
The pack feels light, comfortable and fits well - I'm 187cm and have the L/XL size, which feels right. Easy to adjust the size and all the usual straps make it easy to tighten or slacken off according to load, temperature etc.
There doesn't seem to be a point on the front for hanging a visibility lamp/light and there are no reflective markings. 
Hip belt pockets see a bit more robust and roomy than the last version. 
There's a small webbing pocket on the left shoulder strap, too small for a phone or wallet and not weatherproof so I'm not sure what use it serves.
Some 'daisy-chain' loops on the shoulder straps or front of the pack would have been useful.
No integrated cover (as per previous version) but not a problem as I still have my old cover. Still, feels like an odd omission for any pack.
All considered, a nice pack for long day hikes, maybe a weekend trip.
review.name: Good basic pack for day/weekend hikes

review.reviewBody: Have used this backpack for about 10 hikes now and am very impressed.  Great size for a lot of gear, adjustable/customizable fit, and lots of places to store (hip belt, top, two side water holders, back pocket, etc.). Also bought the Osprey 3L water bladder, and it fits well (and is a great optional feature).  The hiking pole holders make good, accesible storage, but easy to extract while on the trail.  I would recomend buying the raincover as accessory.  First hike with rain, we got soaked and while it is water resistent, the pack itself is not waterproof, so everything was wet.  Bought the rainproof cover, and it has worked very well in rainy conditions.  Well worth the price
review.name: Perfect Size and fit

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Superb. More than large enough for day hikes, and just big enough for ultralight overnighters, looking forward to using this pack more but the comfort and quality is typical for Osprey: excellent. Love the new tan color
review.name: Superb. More than large enough

review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I finally got to do a real test with the Talon 33 rather than a few hours hike here and there. I recently (June 2024) did a 40'ish mile 4-day hike up and down the hills of Vermont. The weather was unusually hot and humid for VT and on two days of the hike the heat index was 105 and 106. The AirScape system worked great in the heat and humidity keeping my back mostly dry (with a dri-fit type shirt on). The many adjustments of the pack kept me as comfortable as possible in the conditions with about a 30-pound load. I initially didn't think the T-33 had enough compartments, but once I started to fill it out with gear it did indeed have enough. The biggest complaint I had was the location of the pockets in the back. I wished that they were located a little higher. I used them for water bottles since the well documented internal hydration pack really doesn't work that well/is a hassle. I couldn't reach the bottles without having to take the pack off and I really just wanted to drink on the go. I wish the pockets started higher. I eventually just made sure I had a tall water bottle and I put a false base in the pocket so the water bottle sat higher. I thought that the 33 might be a little light on actually being able to hold 33l, but that was just my observation.
review.name: I finally got to do

review.reviewBody:
I've had the original Talon 33 for 10 years, hiked with it a lot. The pack felt designed to be light above all else. Carry was adequate if I didn't push the load, lots of useful features, but I really disliked that the pack only had one pair of compression straps low on the pack body. This hindered the carry. When I saw that Osprey had dropped a new version with 2 sets of compression straps I decided up upgrade. After a few months with the new pack, here's what I've learned.

The new suspension is more substantial. Same thin foam padding but more of it in back panel, hipbelt, and shoulder harness, plus a sculpted back panel, and a continuous-wrap back pad and hipbelt mean this pack will carry some weight. OK, I've carried to 22 lb, and the pack is not bothered. The hipbelt pockets are larger, but somehow harder to open and close.. Could just be me. Anyway, a definite improvement.

Osprey made this less of an improvement by a design change: the ends of the lower compression straps are sewn to the ends of the hipbelt pocket on each side. When you tighten the compression strap it distorts the hipbelt. It's not like you can put on the pack, tighten the hipbelt, then reach back to tighten the lower straps - at least I can't. I would have returned the pack over this, but my wife modded the straps by sewing the ends to a spot on the pack body. Check this feature carefully; it may annoy you as much as it does me.

The new 33 is heavier than the original, but not much. Osprey shaved weight by speccing narrower webbing and smaller buckles throughout. Mostly this works, though in cold weather the small buckles are a nuisance. The new top lid is similar to the old, though with improved pockets. On the old pack I didn't care that the top lid was fixed; the pack could deal with overloading. The new suspension can (IMO), and a floating top lid would be nice.

The old pack had a great hydration sleeve - easy to load and unload, carried a bladder well. The new pack has a much tighter sleeve, and it's really hard to get a bladder past the new back panel. Once the bladder is in it still carries well. Better hose routing would be nice. The elastic bands are already a bit stretched out. How about a velcro hose tether like my wife's Deuter pack has? 

Features are pretty much like the original. back and side stretch pockets, tool loops and tethers, a stretch cord for retaining hiking poles (I"ve never used it), etc. Lots of places to stick stuff on the outside of the pack to keep them handy. Except for a place to clip a camera bag for my camera. No place on the shoulder straps to hang that. Sigh.

Sizing remains a fiction. I have a 19" back, should be between S/M and M/L according to Osprey. In fact the pack hangs below my shoulders so much that the load lifter straps can't do any lifting because they're already below my shoulders. With the new suspension this pack can actually carry 20+ lb, and that's when I notice the weight on my shoulders. The back panel can handle it, but the pack is too short. Honestly, there needs to be a third size, a L/XL. 19" is not that big. I know people whose backs measure 20" and more....

So, all in all a worthy improvement. They kept the weight close to the original while making the pack more capable. A couple issues - the compression straps, the back length - to check out, but worth a look.
review.name: Good update, but with one flaw...

name: Talon 33L Backpack

review.reviewBody: The bag is awesome! You can pack quite a lot into this thing. It is also super nice to adjust from a duffel into a backpack. Great for short trip getaways or for bringing along with you on a climbing adventure. The straps can feel slightly uneven with heavier items in the bag, but if adjusted properly they are great!
review.name: Super Packable!

review.reviewBody: Love this bag! I packed my husband and I for a weekend camping trip in this bag, everything fit so well. The different options to carry the bag is great! Sturdy bag I didnt feel I had to worry about at all even packed to the brim with stuff it looks good and hold its shape well. Love that it has its own pocket to store itself. Highly recommend!
review.name: Nailed it!

review.reviewBody: I'm a big fan of this duffel. The storability makes it great for throwing in as a smaller gym bag when traveling, and the size is perfect for weekend getaways or demanding gym sessions. I haven't flown with it yet, but being able to store the backpack straps inside will be great for either a carry-on or checked luggage. It also sits comfortably when full, despite not having any internal support structure such as a frame. The yellow-on-blue looks incredible. Finally, it has a ton of pockets for organizing gear, which I find many duffels to be lacking. Helly Hansen nailed this bag, and the price is right!
review.name: Lightweight and Functional

review.reviewBody:
Looking forward to bringing this duffel on my trip to Portugal next month! It's the perfect size for a carry-on, has a sturdy outer material, and offers multiple zippered pockets for organization. 

I particularly appreciate the shoulder straps that allow it to be carried like a backpack. And they can easily be tucked into a zippered compartment so you can store the pack under the airplane seat without the straps getting caught on anything. There are 4 grab handles on each side of the bag so it can be easily picked up from any angle. 

I also love that the duffel can be packed into its own pocket. I usually end up tossing my duffel bags into the abyss of my closet because they are too awkward to store. This one, however, packs into a neat little cube.
review.name: Perfect for adventure traveling

review.reviewBody: This pack is awesome! The stowable backpack straps are super comfortable and make carrying a breeze. It also packs into its own pocket making it easy to bring along as a travel daypack.
review.name: The lightweight weekender

review.reviewBody: Perfect weight for cool thru hot weather. Great protection from the sun as a result of the ease of wear in the heat.

review.name: Good for wide range of temps

review.reviewBody: I like the feel of the fabric on hot days. Its breathable and lightweight l. Having the quarter zip allows me to dump heat as needed. Its not as light as some other sun hoodies but its well made and definitely in my rotation now.
review.name: Soft fabric and great functionality

review.reviewBody: Very comfy and a bit more rugged than the Aspen glow shirts which I own two of, but are also my day to day shirts. This is nice because I can wear a shirt underneath and still have this on doing layers.
review.name: Very nice day over shirt

review.reviewBody: Great for sun and some wind protection climbing or hiking.
review.name: comfortable

review.reviewBody: Full disclosure, I didn't use it in the field. I was hoping for a sun hoodie and liked the quarter zip. But when it arrived I discovered it was more of a "slick" material, less breathable and moisture-wicking than I hoped. I realized in retrospect it was probably designed as a light layer for a variety of weather including mist and a light chill, not the hot summer sun in the desert and eastern sierras. It wasn't the feel and use case that I wanted, so I returned it.
review.name: not as breathable as I hoped

review.reviewBody: It's as advertised though I've worn for just one climb but well fit and comfortable.

description: Buy the Gregory Inertia 18L H2O Hydration Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Inertia 18L H2O Hydration Pack
hasVariant.description: Buy the Gregory Inertia 18L H2O Hydration Pack online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I purchased this daypack for 7 days of hiking in Yosemite.  Inside the pack, I carried a full water bladder, 1 fleece hoody, 1 rain jacket, 1 wind shirt, 1st aid kit, snacks and a small pair of binoculars.  On the outside, I attached my hiking poles and a full 1 L Nalgene bottle.

I am 5'11 and weigh 180 lbs.  The pack fit me really well once I dialed it into how I like to wear a daypack.  I removed the hip belt because it wasn't a feature that I wanted to use.

The pack carried my loadout of 15 lbs nicely.  The shoulder straps are minimalist-style but are still comfortable.  I only experienced shoulder fatigue after 8 or 9 hours of use on my longer days on trail.

Overall, I am really pleased with this pack.  I tried on several daypacks before I made the purchase and I feel like I got exactly what I was looking for.
review.name: Intertia 18L for the Win!

review.reviewBody: I love this pack for day trips, both hiking and snowshoe.  The bladder is easy to access, fill, and secure.  The main compartment has sufficient space for a first aid kit, food, wind/water proof shell with room to spare.  I only wish that it had a better means to secure snow shoes for hikes where they are not initially needed.
review.name: Perfect day trip pack

review.reviewBody: This is a fantastic and comfortable day pack. I have used it on a few hikes and it has been awesome. The mesh panel helps with breathability, but if you run hot youll still sweat with this pack. I love the separate hydration sleeve and the clip that keeps the hydration pack steady. The hydration pack it comes with is amazing and easy to clean. The only think that could make it better would be a rain cover to go with the pack.
review.name: Awesome Day Pack

review.reviewBody:
I like the fact that this pack has three outer mesh pockets, one 3L water reservoir compartment including hose routing straps, and a comfy breathable meshed back support plus shoulder straps. 

I WOULD LOVE this pack if it had one additional inner pocket for keeping valuable electronics and wallet away from easy reach and thieves.

I WOULD ALSO LOVE this pack if it had a single-handed, quick-pull draw cord with a weather flap seal in order to access the MAIN COMPARTMENT without the use of a cumbersome zipper, which slows me down when in  outdoor conditions.

Other than that, this pack is beautifully made.
review.name: Would love it, if

review.reviewBody: This H2O backpack is awesome in every aspect.  Quality materials, great fit and many options.
review.name: Outstanding Quality

review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I did receive this pack as a #giftedproduct, but that in no way influences my review or remarks. I have been a huge fan of Gregory for years. I use their bags for backpacking, day hikes, and commuting. Their bags are top-notch quality, feature-rich and comfortable. The Inertia 18 is no exception. 
Why do I love it? The small footprint gives way to a massive amount of capacity without feeling too bulgy. The bag itself has a shape that it doesn't lose when empty - making it easy to pack up, sort through, and clean up. It's got all the bells and whistles that can be jammed into a small package: Amply sized main storage compartment, a separate hydration pocket, a front knickknack pocket at the top, a mesh water bottle side pocket, and a bonus zip pocket on the other side. 
The back panel mesh on the back allows pretty good airflow, and the straps are nice and lightweight so they don't feel too bulky or heavy - even when the sweat hits. 
But the gem: The hydration system. Gregory absolutely killed the game with their hydration systems - hands-down best on the market. This bag comes with a 2L bladder which is the perfect size for most hikes that I do. On hot days, I will throw an iced-down water bottle in the side pocket. (I Live in AZ). The bladder has a quick release system meaning you can completely pull it out to fill it up. So easy and clean. It has a wide mouth to make filling simple. There is a handle to help carry the bladder outside of the bag. The lid twists on and off with ease and is very secure - which is where many other brands go amiss. The INertia's hydration compartment has a built-in hook to hang the bag from so it doesn't slump around, and because of the hardened back panel of the bladder, it stays in place - and keeps that water upright and ready to flow. 
It's also the simplest water hydration system to clean. Gregory integrated a hook for you to be able to hang the bladder upside down. I usually throw a paper towel or small towel in the bottom to soak up any water, making sure to keep the mouth open for airflow while the bladder dries itself out.
review.name: Absolutely Perfect Bag for Day Hikes + Hydration

name: Inertia 18L H2O Hydration Pack

review.reviewBody: However, off white/tan bottom would be difficult to keep clean on trail. I returned it
review.name: Bag was ok

review.reviewBody: I've used this on many trips and never had an issue with it.
review.name: Solid backpack that is very durable

review.reviewBody: No way this is 30l. The Included sleeve feels cheap. When other reviewer say this loads too heavy what they mean is there is no way to carry it in your back normally. I tried to make this work but it was a complete waste of money
review.name: A trash bag would be better

review.reviewBody:
I have a variety of backpacks and have been looking for a light weight, but large capacity pack.  This one hits the marks! 

I love my highly engineered *sprey, but sometimes I don't need all of the organization.  Without the pre-configured pockets, the Refugio allows me to organize to my own specs (with packing cubes).  My favorite feature is the removable laptop sleeve - this is perfect because sometimes you need it and sometimes you don't. I love the flexibility a surprised that his was one of the only packs that offers that feature. 

Without the extra weight of over zealous organization, this easily converts to a day back. The overall size is manageable for an under the seat personal carry on. Overall a great choice in travel/commuting backpack.
review.name: Perfect for light travel

review.reviewBody:
I tried to love these pants but I hate them. They cut into your stomach all day and leave an awful imprint in your skin from the elastic waste belt. Whoever put these through production never sat down in them. 

3 stars because they are cute and the fabric is soft but theyre awful to wear if you need to sit for any period of time.
review.name: Fine if you dont sit down

review.reviewBody:
These pants have a really short inseam and the crotch area has a too much extra fabric so it isn't a very flattering fit. They are also so high waisted that they go up to my ribcage.
The fabric and stretch is comfortable and the adjustable waistband is nice.
review.name: meh

review.reviewBody: I now have 3 pairs of these pants (olive, warm brown, and purple).  They are great GO TO pants.  You can wear them hiking, around town or even to work.  I'm a teacher and these offer good stretch but look a little more put together than jeans.  I LOVE the built in belt that add a pop of color.  My only qualm is the inseam.  As you can see I role up mine because when they are down they are an awkward length.  I do have longer legs and I with they offered these pants in longer inseams! A 31" would be great!
review.name: Great Go To Pants ( A little short...)

review.reviewBody: I bought these pants like 6 months ago and they are my absolute dream pants. I have very short legs so I cuff them at the bottoms which I think looks cute. They are super stretchy and super comfy to wear all day long. I wear them to work where I have a very active job and they have held up very well.
review.name: The BEST pants

review.reviewBody: I like my stoic venture pants but I don't *love* them. The front rise fits well when standing but I find bending or sitting it becomes obvious there is just too much fabric going on there. Might just not be the right fit for my body type. All that being said, I do still wear and like the pants. I love the bright color and fun belt pattern. Great adventure or errand pant, I wore them to pride last weekend and got tons of compliments. I typically wear a medium and bought a medium in these pants.
review.name: Fun colors!

review.reviewBody: These are AWESOME!! I have been slowly buying them in every color!! They are functional but have good structure that gives a professional vibe that allows me to wear them a bit more polished when needed! Please DONt change them and KEEP MAKING NEW COLORS!
review.name: Great Pants!!!

review.reviewBody: These are stretchy and roomy but still nice looking. I have climbed in these with a harness. Definitely high rise. The back pockets are closed by extremely sticky velcro which makes actually using the pockets difficult. I found some velcro to attach from the inside so they are normal pockets now. Would be better with snap buttons or zippers. Lovely colors and cool belts!
review.name: Perfect minus velcro pockets

review.reviewBody: Good for girls with wider hips and a smaller waist! Very comfy
review.name: Favorite climbing pants!

review.reviewBody:
GEEZ louise, I love these. I was totally impulse swayed by the dual-toned blue/green with pink belt pair during a sale and I'm so glad I went for them. 

Like many others, I often have a hard time with pants where if they fit the leg they don't fit the booty, if they fit the booty they don't fit the waist, if they fit everywhere they aren't long enough, etc. Especially with outdoor industry brands. 

Not with these pants! They are genuinely high waisted, they fit around the wide of my hips but taper nicely around the leg, and go all the way to my ankles. I love the adjustable belt, and the zing of color is so cute. The fabric is surprisingly soft but feels durable. And it has give to it! I can move any which way completely comfortably. 

I probably won't wear these on backcountry trips since they are cotton but for daytrips and general wear--WOW. Can't sing enough praises. The next time there is a sale, I will be grabbing more...probably several.

Sizing: Usually I am  6/Medium but purchased these in a small after seeing that recommendation from other reviews, and the S fits perfect. I might could fit into an XS but it'd be a tight fit, maybe uncomfortable/with less accommodation for big movement. I'd say size down because the S already has a looser drape; I think my usual M might cross the threshold from attractively oversized into a little too big. 

Overall: Wonderful pant! Get them! (Size down)

My only wishes for improvement would be: Easier adjustment of belt sizing (I have to undo the belt and use both hands to make an adjustment, although this might get easier with more wear on the belt) and a non-velcro closure for the back pockets, it's already snagged some things I've put in my pockets.
review.name: Actually accommodates my proportions

name: Venture Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody:
A bad crash destroyed my previous dropper and I needed a replacement ASAP. The Highline 3 checked all the boxes and was very easy to install using the existing remote and cable.
Build quality is remarkable and it's very smooth in use. Cheaper than most alternatives.
review.name: Must-have upgrade

review.reviewBody: This is the 2nd one I've purchased.  They may not be the lightest out there but the value is hard to beat.  I pair this with a cheap $20 amazon remote and it works flawlessly.  I put this on my son's bike who races for his high school and after 3 seasons there are no issues or stickiness.  Love the feature to be able to easily lubricate the main seal in a matter of minutes.
review.name: Best dropper for the money

review.reviewBody: Exactly what I was looking for in an internal dropper post. Easy installation, smooth operation.
review.name: Works Great

review.reviewBody: The actuation is fantastic and it comes with jagwire cable and cable housing which is very expensive stuff. It has everything you need to set up if you already have a lever and the actuation is very good.
review.name: Amazing dropper post

review.reviewBody: 2 years later and its still working flawlessly. I use this with the wolf tooth remote and have had it in my bike for the last 2 seasons with no issues or repair. Its quick to come back up and doesnt need your full body weight to lower. Ill likely buy it again for once the dropper on my other bike fails.
review.name: Works every time

review.reviewBody: Fast action.  Smooth action.  Easy install.
review.name: I really like it

review.reviewBody: First dropper post I have owned, and I only have initial impressions, but they are really positive. The install was easy and the dropper post looks great. I paired it with the crankbrothers lever and they both function well. The 125mm (~5") drop is just about right for me at my height (5'9"); I could maybe do with a 150mm. There is a very slight wobble in the post as mentioned before, but if I hadn't read the prior reviews, I may not have even noticed the wobble. The wobble seems to be in the actual post though, not where the seat is clamped to the post (that part is solid and I like how it adjusts). The action of the post is smooth and the return is sufficiently quick. As far as I can tell the components/material are high quality and feel strong/durable; I think this post will last me for quite some time. I'll try and update the post later if my impression changes. As of right now I am happy with my purchase. Even though I don't have experience with other dropper posts to compare too, I would buy the highline 3 again.
review.name: Excellent Dropper Post
comment: Probably shouldn't give five stars when it has wobble.

name: Highline 3 Dropper Seatpost

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Mummy Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I havent personally used it yet as I am waiting for when I go camping , but I tried it a home for a bit and it seems like a very good product. It fits good and is comfortable
review.name: Seems like a good product cant wait to go camping now!

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Mummy Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I was hesitant to leave this review but honest reviews are important and everyone sleeps differently. | did not like sleeping in the liner, I found because it was polyester I sweat and was uncomfortable. I was hopeful because my husband has the warmer Reactor liner and uses it in the colder months and likes it. I had to move to a merino wool liner.
review.name: Not For Me But My Husband Likes His

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Mummy Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Used this liner at 20k and it was that little bit of extra I wanted. Not much extra weight for a lot of extra warmth.
review.name: Bag liner

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Mummy Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Packaging is a breeze and easy to. Its seamless to set up and unpack and get situated I cant tell much on the warmth as it didnt fit the situation for insulation but I believe great temperature control .
review.name: Very nice

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Mummy Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I love the material of this sleeping bag! It provides the perfect amount of warmth without getting too hot especially with living in the south. I also love that it is big enough light to fit people of all heights up to 66.
review.name: Super cozy and great for all heights!

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Mummy Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: I wanted something I could use during the early camping season in the high country and desert of the Four Corners Region and this works perfectly. I have a double wide 30 degree sleeping bag that I use and in the early spring it still gets cold in the lower mountains. Even in the desert there are cold nights and Im tired of sleeping in my skiing base layers these nights. I've used this liner three times now and love it. The first time was in early April in the desert and it got down to 42 at night. I was very comfortable in the sleeping bag by myself with the liner on. It was a little difficult in the middle of the night when nature called but I managed. The second time I used this was around the end of April and beginning of May at an elevation of 7,000 and lows of high 40's. Once again it worked great and was easier to use in the middle of the night. The key was to fully release the feet cord. The last time I used it was just a week ago in the desert with lows of mid 50's. This time I used my hammock & blankets along with the liner. I was warm and comfortable all night. Overall I love this liner and it meets all my needs for a comfortable nights sleep.
review.name: Excellent Layer For Cold Nights

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Mummy Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody:
[This review was collected as part of a promotion.] Ready for beach camping! 
As the beach is cold in the night is SO COSY! 
the comfort on this liner was amazing. The packability on it, doesnt add too much space in your beach bag! Fits amazing with you outfit at night and great reflector! 
Looks like its going to have good durability for multiple camping this year! Absolutely recommended.
review.name: BEACH CAMP READY!!

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Mummy Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] I need this liner for my sleeping bag so bad because Im always cold and when me and my husband camping I always want to me cozy and this liner will help so much! Its great size, amazing material and I love this yellow color!
review.name: Super cosy!

review.itemreviewed: Reactor Mummy Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] This is super lightweight and compact which makes it very travel friendly. The size is pretty great since it opens at both ends and can accommodate many heights. Cozy liner!
review.name: Cozy and compact

name: Reactor Mummy Drawcord Sleeping Bag Liner

Bought these for my gravel bike and loved them so much I ended buying a set for my road bike as well.  

With normal sizing they have an all road feel and very comfortable in the drops, where I feel the flare makes more of a natural riding position.  Sizing them up or down, which is what I did for my bikes, dials them in for road or gravel.

description: Buy the Sea To Summit Frontier UL Two Pot Multi-Set - 2 Person online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Frontier UL Two Pot Multi-Set - 2 Person
hasVariant.description: Buy the Sea To Summit Frontier UL Two Pot Multi-Set - 2 Person online or shop all Hike & Camp from Backcountry.com.

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Two Pot Multi-Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] First off why I gave four stars. The handle is too heavy for the small pot. When empty with handle attached the pot tips over. I use these with my overland set up so space is not an issue. The pots are well made and distribute heat evenly. Clean up is easy because of the non stick surface. I like how the pots nest into each other with the handles inverted also securing the lids. The microfiber towel in between the two pots is a nice touch to insure the pots dont scratch themselves in transport. These replaced an old MSR cook set that I had for over 30 years. They were much bigger but too big for what I needed. I can cook for two people with the Sea to Summet set plenty of capacity. All in all very pleased.
review.name: Frontier Ultralight Two Pot Set

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Two Pot Multi-Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody: [This review was collected as part of a promotion.] The pots are firstly well made and have a nice fit / finish. I like the sizes as they provide good options.I feel like some others are either too large or too small. The handle is nice that it can be removed and its easy to snap back on when needed. The nesting storage is always good as well. Only thing that could be lighter is possibly titanium but its extremely light for the set and I dont think that would be worth changing. One thing that could be nice is the handle interface being on the lid as well to snap into just to not be fighting steam with your hands but not a deal breaker. Good pot set and might end up getting another set here soon. Do recommend
review.name: U.L. Two pot set

review.itemreviewed: Frontier UL Two Pot Multi-Set - 2 Person
review.reviewBody:
I've used the collapsible 1.4L pot from Sea to Summit for a couple of years now and really enjoy how compact it is, so I was a little hesitant on the non-collapsibility of these pots. I was concerned about filling these pots up with items that might scratch the non-stick finish. They include a nice cloth that allows the smaller pot to nest into the larger pot and protect them from each other. I used that cloth and a bag to put my stove, fuel, all of my dishes, and utensils, plus my LED light strip into the 3L pot.
It's all kept in nicely by the handle clicked over the lid. The 3L size was not as much of an issue as I thought it would be, just stuff more stuff into it!

I have a large set of pots / pans and the 3L size Frontier is easily the best volume / weight ratio of any of them. Even including the handle in the weight.

The non-stick is AWESOME and the bottom heats very evenly.
I enjoyed cooking in this much more than my 1.4L collapsible pot.

The lid "hook" for placing the lid on the side of the pot is a nice feature...always hard to find a clean place for your lid!

I also had no problem keeping the lid in place for draining pasta, nice solid lid fit on the pot.

My only "issue" is the bottom of the pots has an "indent". This is great for strength, but the diameter of the indent is slightly smaller than my optimus crux stove...so the pot is a little unstable / off-kilter on the stove.

Still 5 stars overall. This is a great pot set.
review.name: My new favorite cooking pot!

name: Frontier UL Two Pot Multi-Set - 2 Person

review.reviewBody: Disappointed in the fabric. Not as thick as I expected or linedand unfortunately, it picks up every dog hair!
review.name: Disappointed

review.reviewBody: The canvas was not as thick as Id hoped and the are not lined. There is no lining. Fit is good. Just disappointed with the fabric.
review.name: Disappointing fabric

review.reviewBody: Love the quality of these pants. Great pockets and the fabric is thick enough to wear in the winter. Only complaint is that they seem slightly larger/baggier than I wanted so I may have gone 1 size down
review.name: Warm, sturdy pants

review.reviewBody: comfy and stylish casual pant that is easy to wear
review.name: jackson ridge pant is just right for me

review.reviewBody: We wear the Jackson Ridge pants when sampling our watershed for PFAS because they are cotton and wont contaminate our samples. The women's pants make me feel like a toddler. Baggy saggy around the butt and hips, kind of short (and I am not tall!) and elastic at the ankles. Not sure who thought this was attractive styling. They are comfortable and the fabric is nice, but that's about all the positives I can find. The men's version are nice, normal pants and I'm going to try ordering a pair of those, hopefully they'll fit better.
review.name: Toddler pants

name: Jackson Ridge Pant - Women's

review.reviewBody: I purchased these shoes for winter riding in order to avoid having to cram toe heaters into my typical shoes and then wrestle with various shoe covers. I sized up 2 sizes as recommended by other purchasers and am happy with the ability to fit either heavier socks or normal socks and toe heaters without issue. Mounting the cleats was a challenge as the bolts were barely long enough to reach.
review.name: Great for their intended purpose!

review.reviewBody: I wear a 41 in normal shoes. I wear a 42 in winter stuff and cycling shoes in order to fit socks. the shoes in the photo are both lake size 42 wides. as you can plainly see the winter boot is much shorter and much narrower. Calling it a 42 is completely outside the realm of reality.
review.name: way too small

review.reviewBody:
I normally wear a 43.5, but I sized up all the way to a 46 to be able to wear thick socks. I got these for fall and winter riding in New England. These are so much better than using shoe covers. With thick socks, my feet stay warm even in freezing temps.

These are a godsend for wide feet. I thought I'd never find shoes that fit until trying these Lake boots. I cinch down the Boa closures and don't get any heel slippage, even though the length is a little long because I sized up for width.

Lake has a super detailed size chart on their website that you can use to see the exact width of the last in mm, which is super helpful for comparison.
review.name: Love these for winter riding

name: MX146-X Wide Cycling Shoe - Men's

description: Buy the Vittoria Agarro G2.0 Trail 4C Tire - 29in online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: Agarro G2.0 Trail 4C Tire - 29in
