hasVariant.name: Agarro G2.0 Trail 4C Tire - 29in
hasVariant.description: Buy the Vittoria Agarro G2.0 Trail 4C Tire - 29in online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: I road less than 1/2 mile on some cross country single-track and got a cut in the sidewall that needed a plug.  I thought it was just bad luck.  The very next ride I again got a larger hole in the tread that also needed a plug.  I am going to try and get some store credit or maybe a discount as this tire is worthless.  I took it off and put on another Maxxis.
review.name: Do not buy this tire!

review.reviewBody:
I usually love Vittoria tires, but had one cut on the main part of the tread within the first 10 miles of use.  This was in Moab on Cap Ahab.  It was unrepairable and I walked.  Maybe this is a one time very off chance deal, but it made me question the durability.  The front is holding fine and holds corners well.  Vittoria tires in general tend to role nice and have an exceptional ride quality (quiet and soft).  

Two star ding on these only because of the very early flat where I essentially threw $60 out the window.  

Used a Maxxis agressor the rest of the trip without issue.  Not a huge maxxis fanboy, but it did hold up better and was exposed to WAY more abuse the Agarro was.
review.name: Mixed Results

review.reviewBody:
So much hype out there over Enduro style tires, but in all actuality, do you really need such a heavy over built tire?  The Agarro's have turned out to be a perfect front and rear combo for almost every Northern Utah trail I have ridden this year.  Granted, I am not dropping a straight downhill lined with jagged rocks.  

Great traction, cornering ability, low rolling resistance and puncture protection.  Very easy to mount with just a floor pump.  

The only time I wish I had something with bigger side knobs is in a really dusty washed out corner - something I encounter less than 5% of my ride.  

If you are riding any trails in the Park City, Ogden, Salt Lake area, I would give these a hard look.
review.name: Great tire for Northern Utah trails...

name: Agarro G2.0 Trail 4C Tire - 29in

review.reviewBody: Really nice for my feet, and I find these an excellent combination of comfortable but still very precise, great on edges and small holds as well as cracks.
review.name: Great shoe

review.reviewBody:
This is my first pair of real climbing shoes and I was not prepared. Having only worn very soft shoes in the year I?ve climbed, the sole felt pretty rough putting them on. The little slings on the heel make it very easy to put on though. The laces make it easy to tighten only the part of the shoe that needs it (I made the first half pretty loose and the second super tight to lock my heel in place).

They felt super painful at first, but I didn?t know that you?re apparently supposed to get the same size/half a size as your own but in MEN?s size. For example, I?m a 9?1/2 in US women and got size 8 US men (the equivalent of size 9 USw), thinking they would be just slightly smaller but nope. My toes were all curled and rubbing on the interior, which was... suboptimal. However, since the gyms are closed now in Canada, I have been wearing them during my online classes to break them in and they?re getting better by the day, so I?m hopeful my feet won?t tear apart by the time I?m bouldering again. Also since they?re leather, they?re supposed to stretch, so I might be fine ? I would probably get street size for multi pitch stuff, but I?m not there yet so I?ll tough it up for now.

From what I?ve seen (trying to use them on my home gym equipement a bit), they are stiff enough to stand on bolts, but soft enough that your feet are working too. The curved front is good to place your weight on your big toe/edge and I know the rubber on this is KILLER for slabs. The stiffness/rubber is also going to be great for crack climbing. 

Overall pretty good except for the sizing surprise, hopefully even better by the time I can actually climb ! Btw I have only climbed indoors as of now
review.name: Pretty good

name: Masai Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: I purchased this headlamp because the NY Times Wirecutter raves about it. I too like the headlamp because it puts out sufficient light and has other features I need.
review.name: Great headlamp

review.reviewBody: My old spot became unreliable, so made the jump to the new version. Very pleased. It functions the same (buttons, taps, etc), however its is lighter, brighter, and can use both batteries or their lithium ion rechargeable batterybest of both worlds.
review.name: Great upgrade

review.reviewBody: The headlamp is great but the red light intensity and beam distance is sub-par. It is only good in a tent, but the moment you walk out in the woods, you won't see the path in front of you. I suggest BlackDimond to change the design and put a bigger mirror around the red LED to make a 8-10m beam length and allow users to see when they walk at night.
review.name: Red light good for tent but not for the woods

review.reviewBody: Light, bright and comfy to wear. So many settings mean I have the perfect light for whatever the occasion. Picked up the BD1500 Battery & Charger for the longer life and fewer disposal batteries. Highly recommend!
review.name: Spot On!

review.reviewBody: I had a very hard time trying to open the battery compartment. Had to use a flat head screwdriver to open it. After that, I have no problem. The headlight will get hot if you have it on super bright setting.
review.name: Spot 400 headlamp

review.reviewBody: In terms of functionality, everything is fine, the brightness is easily adjusted, the modes are changed, it is good that the button is higher and now it is easy to find. Cons, the powertap is very sensitive, sometimes you just accidentally touch it from above and it has already switched. The plastic of the lens began to crack in the corners along with the black plastic around the lens which also began to crack, and the plastic of the strap attachment, small part where it attaches to the body, began to crack. You can still live with sensitive powertap, but the fastening of the strap needs to be repaired and can be critical.
review.name: Quite nice headlamp with nuances

review.reviewBody:
I recently purchased a spot 400 headlamp, and after being satisfied with previous models, I was confident that this would be a great headlamp for home and camping. It was not.

My first issue is, even with the lock on (so that it doesn't turn on , the lamp would drain batteries almost instantly. Literally every time I went to use it I needed to replace the batteries, I also tried several different brand AAA batteries thinking that possibly they were the culprit, same result every time. 

Secondly, this is a flimsy design which upon being dropped on a hard surface from my lap to the ground, the case that holds the batteries was damaged and now the batteries seem to not even stay in their place rendering the lamp completely useless. 

Very disappointed with the lack of quality and durability from what is supposed to be a very rugged brand. 

I contacted black diamond previously regarding a damaged lamp and was told that there is no warranty if purchased from a third party retailer, it any store that is not an official dealer. 

I highly recommend NOT purchasing any headlamps from this company
review.name: Trash

name: Spot 400 Headlamp

review.reviewBody: Very light weight and can pack easily. Surprisingly warmer than expected. Glad I grabbed one of these! I got an M so I could layer it easily. I'm between an S and an M and either would have worked. Nicely made.
review.name: Perfect jacket

review.reviewBody: Cute colors; love that it is reversible. Haven't tried it in very cold weather, but it is warm enough for 45 degrees.
review.name: Teca Clido Hooded Jacket

review.reviewBody: We live in Charleston sc but we still get a few months that are cold. My daughter will love this jacket for Christmas!
review.name: Beautiful jacket

review.reviewBody: Love it. Love that you can wear a long sleeve under and you wont be hot or look bulky. Perfect fit and very accurate description. Highly recommend.
review.name: Perfect

review.reviewBody: I am loving this jacket so far! It is the perfect weight for a 40/50 degree day and is a comfortable fit and weight. I ordered a large, which is my usual size and its perfect. I love that it is reversible and has pockets of both sides. Recommend!
review.name: Love this jacket

review.reviewBody: Pleasantly surprised with this jacket! Its lightweight. Keeps me warm and blocks a decent amount of wind. Glad I made this purchase as it will be a regularly worn item in my wardrobe
review.name: Warm and lightweight

review.reviewBody: This jacket is so fun! You know when you take a jacket off and you have to be careful not to pull the sleeves though; not with this jacket! I wear it each way everyday. Its not cold enough in Arizona to really test its warmth but it does seem very warm! Im 510, 175lb female, broad shoulders, long arms - it fits great!
review.name: Fun!

review.reviewBody: This jacket is warmer than I expected, which was a pleasant surprise. I layer over another layer for an explosion of color, which is satisfying and mood lifting especially in the darker months of fall and winter. Based on measurement guide I ordered a medium, and feel its a bit too generous for me but still love it!
review.name: Fun colors

review.reviewBody: This was my first Cotopaxi purchase and Im in love with my jacket . SoCal lady here and often dont need a heavy coat . This jacket is the perfect weight, easy to travel with. I dig that its reversible but my favorite side is the golden yellow side and it has a hood. Best part is I got it on sale . Lots of pockets too. Yay!
review.name: Teca Clido

review.reviewBody: The jacket is super light weight and folds well (compact) if you plan to pack it for a trip. It fits snug and keeps you warm and the colours are adorable!!. Would 100% recommend getting this. I might get one as a present for my mom while it's on sale.
review.name: Very warm and cozy

name: Teca Calido Hooded Jacket - Women's

review.reviewBody:
I absolutely love this harness. It's plenty light and very comfortable. I've used this for everything from single pitch crag days, to all day multi-pitch's. I'll admit, towards the end of a full day of sitting in the harness my hips will get slightly sore, but it is a worth the trade off for how light this thing is. Fit is true to size for me at a 32 waist in a size Medium.

Blue Ice has got a lot of great things going on, don't sleep on the Cuesta!
review.name: Favorite Harness!

review.reviewBody:
Solid harness from Blue Ice! It's comfortable and light weight. I climbed in the Arc'teryx 395a previously and the Cuesta feels just as nice as many of those premium sport-harnesses. 

Sizing should be comparable to most Edelrid, Black Diamond, and Petzl harnesses. If you're following my path and converting from Arc'teryx, go up a size.
review.name: Light & Comfortable Harness

name: Cuesta Harness

review.itemreviewed: Drone Comp Series High Volume Climbing Shoe
review.reviewBody:
First off, watch the YouTube video about various Mad Rock shoes and how they're different. Love how the company is innovating while keeping the price point low. These are my first pair of Mad Rock shoes, and I'm still getting used to them after a month. People say the sizing between models can vary quite a bit so try to find a physical store first if possible.

1) Coming from La Sportiva/Scarpa, the fit is more aggressive so be careful if attempting to size down. Definitely street size or half size up first.

2) These shoes take much longer to break-in. Usually wearing shoes at 15-30 min intervals through the day with 2-3 sessions works with most shoes, I feel these can take upwards of 8-10.

3) These shoes are quite stiff and least sensitive in my quiver. Almost feels like yanking on footholds with a crowbar. I can see these perform okay on slab since the rubber is extremely sticky, but would probably choose something else with more feedback. Maybe this will change over the next 6-12 months.

As someone who mostly sport climbs, these have their place but not necessarily something I'd use as a daily driver.
review.name: Great shoe with some caveats

review.itemreviewed: Drone Comp Series High Volume Climbing Shoe
review.reviewBody:
After trying out a bunch of climbing shoes, I'm pretty sure the Drone Comps will be my forever shoe. It's the fantasy shoe I've been looking for: outrageously comfortable, great for edging, and sticks to everything. I've never felt so sure on my feet before. Really blows away the competition on fit, comfort, and rubber. There really is no rubber this sticky. I'm sorry, but I will never climb in XS Grip 2 again. And it manages to be this sticky without being too soft. The comfort is outstanding. My toes crimp and are held in that position cozily with no hot spots or painful pressure. Best of all, there's enough room at the forefoot for all of my toes without pushing them in at an unhealthy angle. I have hereditary bunions and it was extremely important that the shoe not push in the toes since that would worsen the bunions (any worse and I'll need surgery). The soft rubber has stretched to accommodate my bunions fine. So I highly highly recommend this shoe to anyone with bunions. And I'm pleased that Drone went the way of having a full sole on a comp shoe. I'm 135 lbs, and I find it the toe plenty supportive enough for small foot chips with no toe pain (including on my twisted big toes). The shoe tension is perfect - it bends when you need it, but won't give out on small feet. Since the first session, I could wear them for 2 hours straight without having to take them off, and when I do remove them at the end of a session, my toes feel fine - no foot pain! The maker said they made only the toe curve down aggressively unlike other brands which start the downturn in the middle of the foot, which is uncomfortable since there's no joint in the middle of your sole. It works -- the shoe feels almost flat but isn't, and it still works great in overhangs. 

A couple comparisons: Unparallel Flagship - amazing shoes, but not as good for my feet. They push my big toe inward and are less comfortable overall (though quite reasonable for an aggressive shoe). They're also softer, which made my big toes hurt on small feet. Regular Drones - waaay too clunky. Returned immediately. Tenaya Iati and Tarifa - both pushed my big toes in, were too narrow, too stiff, and had slippery rubber. I find all La Sportivas quite uncomfortable as well as the Scarpa Instinct S. Also tried the new Scarpa Vapor S and the La Sportiva Kubo - both flat-lasted shoes for comfort, but both of them were strangely tight in the toe which led to them being less comfortable than the Drone Comps! Take it from me -- if you want a combination of comfort and performance, it just doesn't get any better than these. Drone really nailed it! (FYI, I wear size 7 in street shoes and had to size up to 7.5 for a comfortable fit).
review.name: My Forever Shoe

review.itemreviewed: Drone Comp Series High Volume Climbing Shoe
review.reviewBody:
This is my first pair of Madrocks, but I'm soooo incredibly happy that these are my first pair. To note, the Drones CS do run pretty true to size. They have about  to  size stretch, but I made the mistake of going with a pair that felt "just right" before getting on the wall. After 2 sessions, the stretch factor became much more apparent. They have a very interesting flex point in the midsole that I was not expecting and took a bit of getting used to, BUT now I love it. I truly allows me to apply a bit of extra force to physically wrap the shoe around a hold. The flex is why I wish I went down half a size. Go with a fit that's as uncomfortably snug without being painful as possible. They do fit snugger than the OG drones & drone 2.0's.
The rubber, super sticky, as advertised.
love love love them, will definitely be getting another pair when the time comes.
review.name: Great show at an amazing price

review.itemreviewed: Drone Comp Series High Volume Climbing Shoe
review.reviewBody: I have had several pairs of Mad Rock shoes and these are my favorite! They are more aggressive (down-turned) than my Drone LVs and Im able to edge better in them. The whole shoe is also a little more narrow than my Drone LVs (which are also size 6.5) and that fits my foot better. Overall, I feel that I have more control with them and they are stickier. Im a big fan!
review.name: Great fit with a perfect edge!

name: Drone Comp Series High Volume Climbing Shoe

review.reviewBody: I bought this about a month ago. Love it! However, I will be returning it because the snaps on the handles do not snap securely. They are the only reason Im not giving five stars. I love everything else about this duffle. Just wish the snaps were of equal quality to the rest of the bag.
review.name: Great dufflebut

review.reviewBody: Love this duffel especially for river and camping trips. I purchased the 90L, so when it's loaded up, it can be a bit heavy to haul around, but I love how spacious it is and how easy it is to fold up as an extra carry on if I go shopping where I travel. The 60L may have been more practical, but I don't like feeling overstuffed, so I am happy with the size I chose.
review.name: Great bag, it's massive!

review.reviewBody: This duffel bag is considerably lighter than all my other duffel bags.  Considering its made by MR, I have no doubt it is stronger too.  The coated fabric is really nice for light splashes and such.  I don't believe the zippers are waterproof, but this is not supposed to be a dry bag.  The zippers do seem very durable and likely to take a lot of abuse.  This is my new favorite duffel bag.
review.name: Light and Durable!

review.reviewBody: This bag holds 1 pair of pants a pair of sweatpants 4 shortsleeved t shirts 2 long sleeve t shirts 6 pairs of underwear 6 pair of socks a 12 inch by 7 inch shaving bag in the main compartment one side carries chargers and backup batteries the other side carries 4 med bottles. Its perfect for me
review.name: Just the right size

review.reviewBody: Well thought out, and great quality, except for the snaps on the grab handle which dont stay snapped!
review.name: Nice bag!

review.reviewBody: I travel to work and spend on average 96hrs there. I like that there is a compartment to put my dirty clothes although I think that compartment could be a little larger. The overall design is great and there are enough zippered pockets to separate my gear the way I like. Quality of materials and build quality appear on par with other Mystery Ranch products and I anticipate this to be a durable product.
review.name: Great Design

review.reviewBody:
40L, slate gray : 
Have used this pack on a few trips both in the US and internationally. There are some things I love about it but some gripes as well. 

Pros: 
- Great material, abrasion resistant and sturdy. Great stitching
- Not a shell but definitely holds shape well
- perfect carry on size
- good open main compartment with a few mesh internal pockets
- best use with packing cubes

Cons:
- backpack straps are not removable, would love to be  able to use front storage when I dont need that way of carry 
- easily stained, just the nature of the fabric, not a deal breaker for me 
- would appreciate a brighter color way for the interior so see contents a bit better
review.name: Solid bag

review.reviewBody: I bought this bag as a present for my son.  He travels quite a bit with some minor camera gear and clothes.  He has told me that this bag fits all his needs for his short weekend jobs. Camera gear, small tripod, 3 days of clothes and toiletries all fit no problem.  Fits in the overhead and he loves the backpack straps option.  He has commented on the quality of the bag, the confidence he has in the zippers and its overall design. Strong work MR!!
review.name: Birthday present getting rave reviews

review.reviewBody: I bought this to transport my skydiving gear to and from the drop zone. Big enough to hold the right and the helmet in its own bag, plus all the accessories and gear. Great quality and rugged.
review.name: Perfect Size for Skydiving Gear

review.reviewBody: I love how this bag was designed for maximum space use. Comfortable to carry and a lot goes into this bag.
review.name: Compartmentalizing at its finest

name: Mission 55L Duffel Bag

review.reviewBody:
So it works I can mount my old ski clamps. BUT:
The bolts rotate in the plastic were they should hold still.
Stuff does not hold in place when mounting them so it's fidgety.
Unnecessarily tall.
Thumb bolts so anyone can just unscrew you rack and steal it. (Replaces these with Nylon lock nets made of stainless steel)

Over all I think there is a simpler design that would hold up better, but they do do what it says on the Tin.
review.name: It works...

review.reviewBody:
Really disappointed in the quality of these mounts. Four mounts come in each package. One of mine looks like it's been melted and reformed, making it unusable. So despite paying for four of these I only got three workable versions. Not worth the money if you can't even use the all of the pieces. 

Otherwise, the pieces I was able to use seemed ok. There are a lot of steps to figure out how to put them together for your rack and your bars but that's expected with a universal mount and the instructions were mostly clear.
review.name: Poor quality

name: Mighty Mount

hasVariant.name: Trigger Full-Face Helmet
hasVariant.description: Buy the iXS Trigger Full-Face Helmet online or shop all Bike from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody:
I use this on off road motorcycle. I ride mostly slow, tight single track. I have some neck issues that even a quite like motorcycle helmet (mine is 950grams) starts to bug me. This one is considerably lighter and has proven to be great.
Ventilation is very good and excellent vision. I usually use safety glasses or mesh glasses- but I used goggles yesterday with good results. 
 The Airoh motorcycle helmet is much plusher, but this was just fine for all day comfort, not quite as nice, but the light weight made it not very noticable.
 I normally wear a medium in most brands, but this small/medium fit just fine. I do loosen adjuster to put back on, but only takes another couple seconds. 

So far, I like it.
review.name: Very light, great ventilation and vision

review.reviewBody:
Wore this for a 30 mile / 3500ft loop around DuPont in Pisgah. Mix of XC/Trail/AM and wanted the protection for the chunky downhill sections at Burnt and Big Rock. No issues on the climbs and able to drink from my camelback. Very light and well ventilated. My head measures 60.5cm around and the M/L 58-62m fits me just right with the stock pads. The magnetic strap works well and is a welcome change to the traditional plastic clips. Tip: Lightly grease the metal screw holes for the visor. My previous IXS Trail helmet rusted and swelled out at those two threaded inserts cracking through shell. Not pretty. Also note that the black on black is actually black on grey (see pic). Overall love this helmet and plan to use it whenever there is potential to smash my face.
UPDATED 11/8/2020: the 2mm metal rods that hold the straps in place in the shell are all rusted out. IXS cheaped out and didn't use stainless or some other corrosion proof material. Had to pop them out and replace the rods with some 2mm stainless cut to size I ordered off Amazon. So tired of IXS and rust on my helmets. Stop using cheap hardware on 250$ helmets!!!
review.name: Light and breathable, UPDATED

review.reviewBody:
My first new DH helmet in over a decade. 
 Super light and Very comfortable. The ratchet closer system makes a secure and precise fit every ride. 
 You don?t feel any head pull around fast berms or bobbing while riding rock gardens. 
 Super stoked ??
review.name: IXS Trigger

review.reviewBody:
I bought the Trigger AM at the start of this season, and I liked it so much I bought the FF too. I'm a sucker for design and I dig the understated, aggressive look of this piece. The functionality backs up the sharp design. Super light weight, well ventilated, and very comfortable. Heavier helmets fatigue your neck muscles after a long day, but with the Trigger FF I don't even feel the urge to remove it when riding the lift.  I also appreciate the adjustable cradle and cheek pads, both of which I played around with until I dialed the fit.
I haven't crashed it yet, so I'm trusting all that safety tech will do what it's supposed to and keep my teeth attached to my face.
My head measures at 56.5 cm and the S/M fits perfectly.  Well done, IXS.
review.name: Trail helmet weight, DH certified

name: Trigger Full-Face Helmet

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Hooded Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I purchased the gray--and not the print shown. It feels really nice on the skin and drapes well.

 I'm a near 80 year old guy, but love the versatility and quality of Patagonia. (I once went for my 10 year DMV photo and the examiner noticed I was wearing the same Patagonia shirt as my previous photo.) Their stuff lasts.
review.name: Patagonia Quality. Nice fit. Hood is fun

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Hooded Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have three of these hoodies. It's a very versatile piece that can be worn during both summer and winter as an added layer.
review.name: Nice hoodie!

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Hooded Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Soft, cool fabric and well made like all Patagonia stuff. Great for hikes in full sun and warm temperatures. Im a slim build with long arms and medium fits great. Recommend it.
review.name: Excellent Hoodie

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Hooded Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I was hoping for the material to be a little on the thicker side, but it is too thin for my comfort.
review.name: Super thing material

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Hooded Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Have worn it several days in late June/ early July. With just a bit of perspiration & moving air, this shirt is weirdly cool in hot, humid conditions. Its super comfortable & nice to the touch. Hood fits well & stays in place better than other brands I own. If it holds up like other Patagonia clothes ive purchased, theyve got another winner on their hands!
review.name: Best fitting & performing sun hoodie yet

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Hooded Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I own two of these and i've put them through the ringer! One of them is my primary backpacking and kayaking sun hoody and i've worn it on 8 day trips without washing it other than dipping it in the ocean or a lake to rinse it out. They dont really smell after that long with a good rinse. I've also been pleasantly surprised with the durability while wearing a 30+lb pack or while kayaking for 4-6 hours. They don't have any substantial wear or tear and I find them to be comfortable and cool.
review.name: Great Sun hoody!

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Hooded Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: Exactly what you'd expect from Patagonia.  Wears great and super comfy.  True to size
review.name: Worth it

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Hooded Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody:
I have multiple of these shirts in various colors and it has been amazing for hiking/backpacking, biking, kayaking, and running. 

I initially bought this for sun protection and it has been great not having to be as diligent with applying sunscreen, but I realize it was so much more than just a sun shirt. 

This has been super comfortable and very breathable in the hot summer days but surprisingly great at adding that little bit of wind protection when it gets a little nippy.

This has been a shirt that I wear all year long. In the spring/fall I pair this with a raincoat and in the winter I pair this with a puffy and a raincoat. Wearing this under a raincoat makes an amazing difference, it feels less like wearing a plastic bag and makes things so much more comfortable.
review.name: Excellent adventure shirt!

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Hooded Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I have a number of these and I wouldnt walk/hike in the sun without one.  The fabric is cool and the hood is deep enough to cover the sides of your face.
review.name: Excellent sun prot

review.itemreviewed: Capilene Cool Daily Hooded Shirt - Men's
review.reviewBody: I started getting into running to put more mix into my daily workout and during the summer season something like this is a must. I only have cycling kits for the 4 season but not for general training clothes. The cotton shirts and pants I've been using were so heavy and they made my runs less enjoyable but the moment I put this on it felt soo nice and breezy. Due to the thin fabric but nice feeling of the hoody I feel the wind enough to give me a refreshing feeling. The best part is that it's a hoody and most of my hoodies are heavy merino or cotton and it's hellish on sunny days. The Capilene hoody was thin enough for me to feel the breeze too even when I have the hood on. Great stuff. Just wished they had more colors.
review.name: So soft and cloudlike

name: Capilene Cool Daily Hooded Shirt - Men's

review.reviewBody: Love these sunglasses. Perfect condition. Arrived quickly. They are perfect and my go to sunglasses. Thank you backcountry !
review.name: Love these!

review.reviewBody: These unfortunately are too large and none adjustable.  They also appear used.  I am returning.
review.name: Too large, looks used

review.reviewBody: I have matte black (nonpolarized) Ericas and I absolutely love them. Great frames that have lasted about 6 years now. I got these because I wanted a polarized upgrade for fishing, hiking, etc. I found these to feel and look much cheaper than my other ones. Maybe it was just the gloss frame / color combo, but I personally wasn?t a fan. Returned, sadly.
review.name: Great frames, color combo disappointing

name: Erika Polarized Sunglasses - Women's

description: Buy the Candide C1 3L Jacket online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

hasVariant.name: C1 3L Jacket
hasVariant.description: Buy the Candide C1 3L Jacket online or shop all Clothing from Backcountry.com.

review.reviewBody: The quality of the jacket is excellent, what you would expect with a 3L jacket. However, just like another reviewer mentioned, this jacket is extremely tight and cumbersome around the face/chin when fully zipped. Based on that issue I am returning.
review.name: Excellent Quality Meets Poor Design

review.reviewBody: Honestly the jacket is really nice and feels high quality. The length is quite long which is nice for extra coverage. The downside of the jacket is the hood/neck area. Fully zipped you feel like a turtle, with the neck coverage coming really high. If you want to ski with it slightly down, it stands up really tall and is awkwardly in the way. Sadly for that reason, I have to return the jacket. Besides that, seems awesome.
review.name: Weird neck coverage

name: C1 3L Jacket
